definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from

sentences.english: Daquan and the use of weapons technology, is China's traditional sports.
sentences.chinese: 打拳和使用兵器的技術，是我國傳統的體育項目。

sentences.english: Spider kelly taught them to box like featherweights .
sentences.chinese: 斯拜德凱利教他們像次輕量級拳擊手那樣去打拳。

sentences.english: The five boxing wizards jump quickly .
sentences.chinese: 五個打拳擊男巫快速跳動。

sentences.english: You can also learn boxing in the boxing hall, they have a short-term training courses.
sentences.chinese: 你也可以在拳館學習打拳，他們有短期的培訓課程。

sentences.english: When I was younger I loved the way Tyson boxed , where he came from.
sentences.chinese: 當我還年輕的時候我非常喜歡看泰森打拳。

sentences.english: The mother, their this is in the shadowboxing ?
Really? Then how come it's mostly poor people who box? They don't have any other choice.
sentences.chinese: 真的嗎？那爲什麼總是窮人去打拳呢？他們別無選擇。

sentences.english: The five boxing wizards jump quickly.
sentences.chinese: 五個打拳的男巫快速的跳動。

sentences.english: "play boxing without internal, you will get nothing".
Go for a run, play some tennis, ride your bike, or punch a punching bag.
sentences.chinese: 所以，多去跑步，打網球，騎自行車或者打拳擊吧。

sentences.english: " Armored steel fist" just finished robot boxing inspirational mission.
sentences.chinese: 《鐵甲鋼拳》就這樣完成了機器人打拳擊勵志的使命。

sentences.english: Thee five boxing wizards jump quickly.
sentences.chinese: 五個打拳的男巫快速跳動。

sentences.english: If I could move like you, I would still be boxing.
sentences.chinese: 如果我的動作能你那樣敏捷，我就能繼續打拳了。
你只是在隨隨便便打拳擊。

sentences.english: Xx:Max the fox boxes with the ox.
sentences.chinese: 狐狸麥克西和公牛打拳擊。

definition: shadowboxing or Taiji, T'aichi or T'aichichuan/traditional form of physical exercise or relaxation/a martial art

military skill or technique (in former times)/all kinds of martial art sports (some claiming spiritual development)/self-defense/tradition of choreographed fights from opera and film (recent usage)/also called kungfu 功夫/CL:種|种[zhong3]
to practice/to train/to drill/to perfect (one's skill)/exercise/(literary) white silk/to boil and scour raw silk
to fight, esp. with hands/wrestling (as a sport)/to wrestle/to wrestle (against fate, with a problem etc)/to capture prey
